title: Glowing orange brain
data:

| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A huge wrinkled brain, floating just off the floor and glowing with mutagenic energies. Every now and then it seems to pulsate. |

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Spells](#Spells)
- [3 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [4 History](#History)

## Useful Info

**Glowing orange brains** are dangerous [evil](/Evil "Evil") casters which can summon brutal monsters, feed on your intellect, or confuse you. While not too intimidating initially, they can create powerful reinforcements quickly and complicate almost any fight. They can be found in [the Depths](/The_Depths "The Depths"), [the Vaults](/The_Vaults "The Vaults"), and rarely in [the Slime Pits](/The_Slime_Pits "The Slime Pits").

## Spells

| Spell set I |                                                          |                                                      |
| :---------- | -------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------- |
| Slot1       | [Brain Bite](/Brain_Bite "Brain Bite")                   | [Magical flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot2       | [Cause Fear](/Cause_Fear "Cause Fear")                   | [Magical flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot3       | [Shadow Creatures](/Shadow_Creatures "Shadow Creatures") | [Magical flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot4       | [Mass Confusion](/Mass_Confusion "Mass Confusion")       | [Magical flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |
| Slot5       | [Blink](/Blink "Blink")                                  | [Magical flag](/Spell_slot_flags "Spell slot flags") |

## Tips & Tricks

- Use a source of [clarity](/Clarity "Clarity") and try to kill them as quickly as possible to avoid a summoning spree. They aren't too durable, so a few high-powered [Conjurations](/Conjurations "Conjurations") should take them out, but melee fighters may wish to lure them around a corner to avoid a dangerous charge into melee range.
- [Airstrike](/Airstrike "Airstrike") works well, taking advantage of their low AC and flight. [Bolt spells](/Bolt_spells "Bolt spells") or other attacks that let you hit them even when they're hiding behind allies are also handy.
- No matter how frightening their summoned allies are, remember that killing the summoner will eliminate all its summons. This may be a safer, faster escape route than fleeing on foot or trying to [teleport](/Teleport "Teleport") away.
- Because the glowing orange brain can summon creatures, it has access to the [abjuration](/Abjuration "Abjuration") spell.

## History

- In [0.32](/0.32 "0.32"), glowing orange brains will get an [aura](/Aura "Aura") of brilliance and will become [cautious](/Cautious "Cautious").
- Prior to [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), this monster was known as **giant orange brain**.
- Prior to [0.17](/0.17 "0.17"), giant orange brains could cast [Teleport Self](/Teleport_Self "Teleport Self").
- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), giant orange brains knew [Confuse](/Confuse "Confuse") in place of [Mass Confusion](/Mass_Confusion "Mass Confusion").
html:
Glowing orange brain

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.28: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
glowing orange brain G 
HP 36-74
HD 10
XP 717
Speed 10
AC 2
EV 4
Will 100



Resistances rDrown
Vulnerabilities None
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Open doors
Holiness Natural
Size Medium
Type glowing orange brain, glowing orange brain
Flags See invisible
Flying
Unbreathing
Warm-blooded
A huge wrinkled brain, floating just off the floor and glowing with mutagenic energies. Every now and then it seems to pulsate.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Spells
  • 3 Tips & Tricks
  • 4 History

Useful Info

Glowing orange brains are dangerous evil casters which can summon brutal monsters, feed on your intellect, or confuse you. While not too intimidating initially, they can create powerful reinforcements quickly and complicate almost any fight. They can be found in the Depths, the Vaults, and rarely in the Slime Pits.

Spells

Spell set I
Slot1 Brain Bite Magical flag
Slot2 Cause Fear Magical flag
Slot3 Shadow Creatures Magical flag
Slot4 Mass Confusion Magical flag
Slot5 Blink Magical flag

Tips & Tricks

  • Use a source of clarity and try to kill them as quickly as possible to avoid a summoning spree. They aren't too durable, so a few high-powered Conjurations should take them out, but melee fighters may wish to lure them around a corner to avoid a dangerous charge into melee range.
  • Airstrike works well, taking advantage of their low AC and flight. Bolt spells or other attacks that let you hit them even when they're hiding behind allies are also handy.
  • No matter how frightening their summoned allies are, remember that killing the summoner will eliminate all its summons. This may be a safer, faster escape route than fleeing on foot or trying to teleport away.
  • Because the glowing orange brain can summon creatures, it has access to the abjuration spell.

History

  • In 0.32, glowing orange brains will get an aura of brilliance and will become cautious.
  • Prior to 0.19, this monster was known as giant orange brain.
  • Prior to 0.17, giant orange brains could cast Teleport Self.
  • Prior to 0.14, giant orange brains knew Confuse in place of Mass Confusion.
Retrieved from "http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=Glowing_orange_brain&oldid=80380"

{{version028}}
{{monster info}}

==Useful Info==
'''Glowing orange brains''' are dangerous [[evil]] casters which can summon brutal monsters, feed on your intellect, or confuse you. While not too intimidating initially, they can create powerful reinforcements quickly and complicate almost any fight. They can be found in [[the Depths]], [[the Vaults]], and rarely in [[the Slime Pits]].

{{monster spells}}

==Tips & Tricks==
*Use a source of [[clarity]] and try to kill them as quickly as possible to avoid a summoning spree. They aren't too durable, so a few high-powered [[Conjurations]] should take them out, but melee fighters may wish to lure them around a corner to avoid a dangerous charge into melee range.
*[[Airstrike]] works well, taking advantage of their low AC and flight. [[Bolt spells]] or other attacks that let you hit them even when they're hiding behind allies are also handy.
*No matter how frightening their summoned allies are, remember that killing the summoner will eliminate all its summons. This may be a safer, faster escape route than fleeing on foot or trying to [[teleport]] away.
*Because the glowing orange brain can summon creatures, it has access to the [[abjuration]] spell.

==History==
{{CBA|0.32|glowing orange brains will get an [[aura]] of brilliance and will become [[cautious]].}}
*Prior to [[0.19]], this monster was known as '''giant orange brain'''.
*Prior to [[0.17]], giant orange brains could cast [[Teleport Self]].
*Prior to [[0.14]], giant orange brains knew [[Confuse]] in place of [[Mass Confusion]].
